abstract: JPMorgan Chase shares have been stuck trading around book value, which seems slightly unfair to the bank, Breakingviews says.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase shares have been stuck trading around book value, which seems slightly unfair to the bank, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: Jamie Dimon needs an even better postcrisis, Breakingviews says. The chief executive of JPMorgan Chase runs one of the only major banks in the United States that did not post a quarterly loss during the crash.

headline.main: Why Does JPMorgan Trade at Book Value?
